questions.question: What are anionic N-heterocyclic carbenes?
questions.answer: Anionic N-heterocyclic carbenes are a class of NHCs that incorporate a divalent carbon atom with six valence electrons fused in an imidazoline ring, which feature negatively charged groups, enhancing their stability and modifying their electronic properties.

questions.question: How do the weakly coordinating perfluoroalkylphosphorane moieties influence the properties of anionic N-heterocyclic carbenes?
questions.answer: The weakly coordinating perfluoroalkylphosphorane moieties influence the properties of anionic N-heterocyclic carbenes by stabilizing them, enhancing their thermal stability, and modifying their electronic properties such as σ-donor and π-acceptor abilities.

questions.question: What is the significance of the buried volume (%Vbur) in the context of anionic N-heterocyclic carbenes?
questions.answer: The buried volume (%Vbur) is significant as it indicates the steric demand of the anionic N-heterocyclic carbenes, affecting their ability to coordinate to metal centers and their overall reactivity and stability in reactions.

questions.question: True or False: The anionic N-heterocyclic carbenes discussed in the text are less stable than their neutral counterparts.
What role do quantum chemical calculations play in the study of anionic N-heterocyclic carbenes?
questions.answer: Quantum chemical calculations help in evaluating the electronic features of anionic N-heterocyclic carbenes, comparing them to other carbenes, and predicting their σ-donor and π-acceptor properties.

questions.question: How does the orientation of the C2F5 groups affect the properties of the anionic N-heterocyclic carbenes?
questions.answer: The orientation of the C2F5 groups affects the steric environment around the carbene center, influencing the flexibility, steric demand, and possibly the electronic properties of the anionic N-heterocyclic carbenes.

questions.question: True or False: The selenium adduct of the dianionic N-heterocyclic carbene was successfully synthesized.
What challenges are associated with the synthesis of selenium adducts of dianionic N-heterocyclic carbenes?
questions.answer: The challenges include the high steric shielding by the phosphorane substituents, which prevents the reaction with elemental selenium, indicating the sterically demanding nature of the dianionic carbenes.

questions.question: True or False: The anionic N-heterocyclic carbenes can act as ligands in coordination chemistry.
What potential applications do anionic N-heterocyclic carbenes have in the field of chemistry?
questions.answer: Anionic N-heterocyclic carbenes have potential applications as ligands in coordination chemistry, in the stabilization of reactive species, and in the activation of strong bonds due to their unique electronic and steric properties.
